overview: Shadow Watch is a Visual Studio Code extension that continuously monitors codebases to detect architectural problems, generate AI-powered insights, and create comprehensive product documentation. It automatically analyzes code on every save, identifying issues like god objects (files over 1000 lines), circular dependencies, dead code, overly complex functions (over 100 lines), and poor file organization. The extension calculates a health score (0-100%) based on detected issues and presents findings through an interactive sidebar organized by severity: errors for critical problems like very large files, warnings for important issues like circular dependencies, and info-level suggestions for improvements. Shadow Watch integrates seamlessly with AI assistants like Cursor and ChatGPT by formatting insights into optimized prompts that developers can copy with one click, providing AI tools with complete context about architectural problems. The extension also generates product documentation and architecture insights by sending structured code analysis to language models, automatically creating user-facing documentation that describes what applications do rather than how they're built.
whatItDoes: Continuously monitors code and triggers automatic analysis on every file save
Detects very large files (over 1000 lines) indicating potential god objects
Identifies files with too many functions (over 20) suggesting multiple responsibilities
Finds overly complex functions (over 100 lines) that need refactoring
Detects orphaned files that aren't imported or used anywhere in the codebase
Identifies missing or unclear entry points in applications
Checks for potential circular dependency patterns between modules
Calculates overall codebase health score as a percentage from 0-100%
Organizes all findings by severity: errors (critical), warnings (important), info (suggestions)
Formats insights specifically for Cursor AI with optimized prompt structure
Formats insights for ChatGPT with verbose explanations and context
Provides one-click copying of formatted insights to clipboard
Generates comprehensive product documentation by analyzing code with AI
Creates architecture insights describing system design patterns and component relationships
Shows click-to-navigate functionality to jump directly to problem locations
Displays analysis results in specialized tree views: Menu, Analyze Workspace, Product Navigator, AI Insights, Unit Tests
Checks file organization patterns and suggests improvements
Surfaces findings in VSCode's native problems panel alongside compiler errors
Caches analysis results with timestamps and file hashes to avoid redundant processing
Supports 9+ programming languages: Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, Java, Go, Rust, C/C++, Ruby, PHP

gui: Shadow Watch icon in VSCode activity bar that opens the extension sidebar
Menu view showing available commands, current health score percentage, and quick actions
Analyze Workspace view displaying all detected issues organized by category with collapsible sections
Product Navigator view for browsing AI-generated product documentation hierarchically
AI Architecture Insights view showing AI-generated observations about system architecture
Unit Tests Navigator view displaying test organization and coverage
Severity indicators with visual symbols: üî¥ for errors, ‚ö†Ô∏è for warnings, üí° for info
Copy button on each insight for one-click copying to clipboard in LLM-ready format
Refresh button to manually trigger re-analysis of entire workspace
Settings button to configure analysis behavior and AI provider options
Click-to-navigate functionality that opens files at exact line numbers where issues exist
Progress notifications showing analysis status during workspace scans
Health score displayed prominently as percentage (e.g., '72% Health')
Tree structure with expandable/collapsible categories organizing insights by type
Status bar indicator showing analysis progress and completion
Context menu options on right-click for copying specific insights

workflowIntegration: Developer writes code and saves file, Shadow Watch automatically analyzes it within seconds
Developer sees health score drop when introducing architectural problems
Developer expands error category in sidebar to see critical issues like god objects
Developer clicks on specific issue to navigate directly to the problematic code location
Developer clicks copy button to get formatted insights for AI assistant
Developer pastes copied insights into Cursor with context like 'Help me refactor this god object'
Cursor provides specific refactoring steps because it has complete context from Shadow Watch
Developer applies refactoring, saves file, and sees health score improve automatically
Developer runs 'Generate Product Documentation' to create stakeholder-ready documentation
AI analyzes codebase and generates user-facing documentation describing application functionality
Developer reviews generated documentation in Product Navigator view
Developer runs 'Generate AI Architecture Insights' to understand unfamiliar codebase
AI produces architectural observations about design patterns and component relationships
Developer uses insights to understand system before making changes
Developer shares health score trends with team during code reviews
Developer clears cache when needing fresh analysis after major refactoring
Developer switches LLM format from Cursor to ChatGPT when using different AI tool
Developer reviews unit test coverage in Unit Tests Navigator before adding features
problemsSolved: Eliminates hours of manual code review by automatically detecting architectural problems
Prevents technical debt accumulation by flagging issues early before they grow
Provides quantified health metrics so teams can track code quality objectively
Saves time copying code context for AI assistants by formatting it automatically
Makes unfamiliar codebases comprehensible through AI-generated architecture insights
Identifies god objects before they become unmaintainable monoliths
Catches circular dependencies that cause import errors and coupling problems
Finds dead code that increases maintenance burden unnecessarily
Surfaces overly complex functions before they become debugging nightmares
Generates product documentation automatically, eliminating tedious manual writing
Keeps developers focused by surfacing only the most important issues first through severity levels
Accelerates onboarding by providing comprehensive architectural understanding instantly
Enables consistent code quality across teams with objective measurements
Integrates architectural feedback directly into development workflow without context switching
Provides AI assistants with perfect context, eliminating incomplete or incorrect prompts
architecture:
Shadow Watch operates as a continuously-running VSCode extension with a multi-stage analysis pipeline. The core analyzer performs static code analysis by parsing source files to extract structural information including line counts, function counts, import relationships, and code organization patterns. Analysis runs automatically whenever files are saved, with a file watcher detecting changes and triggering incremental analysis only on modified files. Results flow through an insight generator that applies rule-based pattern detection to identify architectural anti-patterns: files exceeding 1000 lines become errors, functions over 100 lines become warnings, and organizational suggestions become info-level findings. A health score calculator weighs all detected issues by severity to produce an overall codebase health percentage.

The caching layer stores analysis results with file hashes and timestamps, enabling the system to skip re-analysis of unchanged files and reduce processing time by approximately 80%. When users request AI-powered features, the LLM integration layer packages code analysis data into structured contexts conforming to specific JSON schemas, sends requests to language model services (OpenAI GPT models), and processes streaming responses back into formatted documentation or insights. The system saves all AI-generated outputs to a .shadow/docs directory with timestamped run folders, automatically loading the most recent results on extension activation to restore state.

The user interface consists of multiple specialized tree view providers, each implementing VSCode's TreeDataProvider interface to populate different sidebar panels. The insights tree view shows the main menu and static analysis results, while dedicated providers handle product documentation navigation, AI architecture insights browsing, and unit test exploration. An LLM formatter transforms insights into different output styles (Cursor-optimized, ChatGPT-verbose, Generic-markdown, Compact-bullets) based on user configuration. A diagnostics provider surfaces findings in VSCode's native problems panel, integrating Shadow Watch warnings alongside compiler errors for unified issue tracking.

descriptions.title: God Object Detection
descriptions.description: Automatically identifies files exceeding 1000 lines of code, flagging them as critical errors because they likely contain too many responsibilities and violate separation of concerns

descriptions.title: Large File Detection
descriptions.description: Warns about files over 500 lines of code that should be considered for refactoring before they become god objects

descriptions.title: Complex Function Detection
descriptions.description: Identifies functions exceeding 100 lines, marking them as warnings because they're difficult to understand, test, and maintain

descriptions.title: Dead Code Detection
descriptions.description: Finds unused functions, classes, and modules that aren't imported anywhere, suggesting they can be safely removed to reduce maintenance burden

descriptions.title: Orphaned File Detection
descriptions.description: Identifies files that exist in the codebase but aren't imported or used by any other module, indicating potential dead code

descriptions.title: Circular Dependency Detection
descriptions.description: Analyzes import graphs to find circular dependency chains between modules that should be broken by introducing abstractions

descriptions.title: Health Score Calculator
descriptions.description: Computes overall codebase health as a percentage (0-100%) by weighing detected issues based on severity, with errors counting more heavily than warnings

descriptions.title: Severity-Based Organization
descriptions.description: Categorizes all findings into three priority levels: errors for critical architectural problems, warnings for important issues, and info for suggestions

descriptions.title: One-Click Copy for AI
descriptions.description: Provides copy buttons throughout the interface that instantly format insights into optimized prompts for pasting into AI assistants

descriptions.title: Cursor Integration
descriptions.description: Special formatting that structures insights specifically for Cursor AI, providing optimal context with file paths, descriptions, and suggestions

descriptions.title: ChatGPT Integration
descriptions.description: Verbose formatting designed for ChatGPT conversations, including detailed explanations, context, and actionable recommendations

descriptions.title: File Organization Checker
descriptions.description: Analyzes how files are organized within the project structure and suggests improvements for better modularity and discoverability

descriptions.title: Entry Point Validator
descriptions.description: Checks that applications have clear, identifiable entry points and warns when entry points are missing or unclear

descriptions.title: Continuous Monitoring
descriptions.description: Automatically triggers analysis whenever files are saved, providing real-time feedback without requiring manual commands

descriptions.title: Incremental Analysis
descriptions.description: Re-analyzes only changed files rather than the entire workspace, keeping analysis fast even in large codebases

descriptions.title: Menu View
descriptions.description: Main tree view in sidebar showing available commands, current health score, and quick access to all extension features

descriptions.title: Analyze Workspace View
descriptions.description: Tree view displaying comprehensive codebase analysis with all detected issues organized by category and severity

descriptions.title: Product Navigator View
descriptions.description: Hierarchical browser for exploring AI-generated product documentation with expandable sections and navigation

descriptions.title: AI Architecture Insights View
descriptions.description: Display panel showing AI-generated observations about system architecture, design patterns, and component relationships

descriptions.title: Unit Tests Navigator View
descriptions.description: Browser showing test file organization, test suites, individual test cases, and coverage information

descriptions.title: Smart Caching
descriptions.description: Stores analysis results with file hashes and timestamps, skipping re-analysis of unchanged files to improve performance by approximately 80%

descriptions.title: Click-to-Navigate
descriptions.description: Allows users to click on any detected issue in the tree views to instantly open the file and jump to the exact line number where the problem exists

relevantFunctions.name: generateInsights
relevantFunctions.description: Main insight generation function that runs all architectural checks and returns array of categorized, severity-based findings

relevantFunctions.name: checkLargeFiles
relevantFunctions.description: Identifies files exceeding 1000 lines and creates error-level insights for very large files indicating god objects

relevantFunctions.name: checkGodObjects
relevantFunctions.description: Detects files with excessive functions (over 20) suggesting multiple responsibilities and violation of single responsibility principle

relevantFunctions.name: checkFunctionComplexity
relevantFunctions.description: Analyzes individual functions to find those exceeding 100 lines, creating warnings about overly complex code

relevantFunctions.name: checkCircularDependencies
relevantFunctions.description: Examines import relationships to identify circular dependency patterns between modules

relevantFunctions.name: checkDeadCode
relevantFunctions.description: Finds unused code elements like functions and modules that aren't imported anywhere in the codebase

relevantFunctions.name: checkOrphanedFiles
relevantFunctions.description: Identifies files that exist but aren't used by any other part of the application

relevantFunctions.name: checkEntryPoints
relevantFunctions.description: Validates that applications have clear, identifiable entry points and warns when missing

relevantFunctions.name: checkFileOrganization
relevantFunctions.description: Analyzes project structure and file organization patterns, suggesting improvements for better modularity

relevantFunctions.name: generateInsightsForFile
relevantFunctions.description: Generates insights specific to a single file, used when analyzing current file instead of entire workspace

relevantFunctions.name: generateProductDocumentation
relevantFunctions.description: Sends code analysis to AI language model to generate comprehensive user-facing product documentation

relevantFunctions.name: generateLLMInsights
relevantFunctions.description: Uses AI to analyze codebase and produce architecture insights about design patterns and system structure

relevantFunctions.name: formatForCursor
relevantFunctions.description: Transforms insights into format optimized specifically for Cursor AI with structured sections and file references

relevantFunctions.name: formatForChatGPT
relevantFunctions.description: Converts insights into verbose format with detailed explanations designed for ChatGPT conversations

relevantFunctions.name: loadSavedInsights
relevantFunctions.description: Loads previously generated AI insights from disk on extension activation to restore state

relevantFunctions.name: loadSavedProductDocs
relevantFunctions.description: Loads previously generated product documentation from disk to restore navigator state

relevantFunctions.name: loadSavedCodeAnalysis
relevantFunctions.description: Restores workspace analysis status from saved files to show analysis state immediately on startup

relevantDataStructures.name: Insight
relevantDataStructures.description: Individual architectural finding with id, title, description, severity level (error/warning/info), category, file location, line number, and actionable suggestion

relevantDataStructures.name: CodeAnalysis
relevantDataStructures.description: Complete workspace analysis result containing arrays of files, functions, statistics, entry points, and structural information

relevantDataStructures.name: AnalysisContext
relevantDataStructures.description: Structured context object sent to AI language models containing code analysis, file information, and configuration for generating insights

relevantDataStructures.name: LLMInsights
relevantDataStructures.description: AI-generated architecture insights containing overview, key components, design patterns, technology stack, and architectural observations

relevantDataStructures.name: EnhancedProductDocumentation
relevantDataStructures.description: AI-generated product documentation with overview, features, user perspective, workflows, problems solved, and architecture description

relevantDataStructures.name: TreeItem
relevantDataStructures.description: Node in the insights tree view representing a menu item, category, insight, or actionable item with icon, label, and command

relevantDataStructures.name: ProductNavItem
relevantDataStructures.description: Navigation node in product documentation browser with title, description, content, and child items for hierarchical browsing

relevantDataStructures.name: InsightItem
relevantDataStructures.description: Node in AI insights viewer representing an architecture observation with title, description, category, and navigation capabilities

relevantDataStructures.name: AnalysisItem
relevantDataStructures.description: Node in analysis viewer representing workspace analysis results with statistics, issues, and health score information

relevantDataStructures.name: UnitTestItem
relevantDataStructures.description: Node in unit tests navigator representing test files, suites, or individual test cases with coverage information

relevantDataStructures.name: FileInfo
relevantDataStructures.description: Information about a single code file including path, lines of code, function count, language, and relationships

relevantDataStructures.name: FunctionInfo
relevantDataStructures.description: Details about a function including name, start line, line count, file location, and complexity metrics

relevantCodeFiles.description: Main extension entry point that activates Shadow Watch, initializes all components, registers commands, and sets up tree views
relevantCodeFiles.purpose: Orchestrates extension lifecycle and wires up all components when VSCode loads the extension

relevantCodeFiles.description: Rule-based insight generator that analyzes code structures to detect architectural anti-patterns and generate categorized findings
relevantCodeFiles.purpose: Identifies specific architectural problems like god objects, circular dependencies, complex functions, and dead code

relevantCodeFiles.description: Static code analyzer that parses source files, extracts structural information, and builds dependency graphs
relevantCodeFiles.purpose: Performs deep analysis of code to understand structure, relationships, and organization

relevantCodeFiles.description: Integration layer for AI language models that sends structured analysis to AI services and processes responses
relevantCodeFiles.purpose: Enables AI-powered features by communicating with OpenAI and processing generated documentation and insights

relevantCodeFiles.description: Service class managing AI language model communication, API key configuration, and response streaming
relevantCodeFiles.purpose: Handles low-level communication with AI APIs, manages authentication, and processes streaming responses

relevantCodeFiles.description: Formatting engine that transforms insights into different output styles optimized for various AI assistants
relevantCodeFiles.purpose: Converts insights into Cursor-optimized, ChatGPT-verbose, Generic-markdown, or Compact-bullets formats

relevantCodeFiles.description: Main sidebar tree view provider displaying menu, commands, health score, and organized insights
relevantCodeFiles.purpose: Provides primary user interface for viewing analysis results and interacting with extension features

relevantCodeFiles.description: Tree view provider for browsing AI-generated product documentation with hierarchical navigation
relevantCodeFiles.purpose: Allows users to explore generated product documentation through expandable sections

relevantCodeFiles.description: Tree view provider displaying AI-generated architecture insights about system design and patterns
relevantCodeFiles.purpose: Shows architectural observations produced by AI analysis in organized, browsable format

relevantCodeFiles.description: Tree view provider showing workspace analysis results with statistics and detected issues
relevantCodeFiles.purpose: Displays comprehensive workspace analysis with health scores and issue summaries

relevantCodeFiles.description: Tree view provider for exploring test file organization, suites, and coverage information
relevantCodeFiles.purpose: Helps users navigate test structure and understand test coverage

relevantCodeFiles.description: Monitors workspace for file changes and triggers incremental analysis on save events
relevantCodeFiles.purpose: Enables continuous monitoring by detecting when files change and initiating re-analysis

relevantCodeFiles.description: Caching system storing analysis results with file hashes and timestamps for performance optimization
relevantCodeFiles.purpose: Avoids redundant analysis by retrieving cached results when files haven't changed

relevantCodeFiles.description: Surfaces detected architectural issues in VSCode's native problems panel
relevantCodeFiles.purpose: Integrates Shadow Watch findings into standard VSCode diagnostic system alongside compiler errors

exampleOutput.description: Analysis results with detected architectural issues organized by severity

Consider breaking it into smaller, focused modules."},{"id":"large-function-src/services/orderProcessor.ts-processOrder","title":"Large Function","description":"Function 'processOrder' has 125 lines, making it difficult to understand and maintain.","severity":"warning","category":"Function Complexity","file":"src/services/orderProcessor.ts","line":45,"suggestion":"Refactor 'processOrder' into smaller, more focused functions. Extract logical blocks into separate functions with clear names."},{"id":"circular-deps-models","title":"Potential Circular Dependency","description":"models/User.ts ‚Üí utils/validation.ts ‚Üí models/User.ts forms a circular import chain.","severity":"warning","category":"Dependencies","suggestion":"Break this cycle by introducing an interface/abstraction or moving shared logic to a separate module."},{"id":"orphaned-file-utils/oldHelper.ts","title":"Orphaned File","description":"utils/oldHelper.ts is not imported by any other file in the codebase.","severity":"info","category":"Dead Code","file":"utils/oldHelper.ts","suggestion":"Consider removing this file if it's no longer needed, or document why it should be kept."}],"llmPrompt":"# Code Architecture Issues

I have 15 architecture issues in my ecommerce application that need attention:

## üî¥ Critical Issues (3 Errors)

### Very Large File
**Category:** Code Organization
**File:** `src/services/orderProcessor.ts`
**Description:** This file has 1450 lines of code, indicating potential god object.
**Suggestion:** Break into smaller, focused modules for order validation, payment processing, inventory management, and notifications.

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Warnings (9)

### Large Function
**Category:** Function Complexity
**File:** `src/services/orderProcessor.ts:45`
**Function:** `processOrder`
**Description:** Function has 125 lines making it hard to maintain.
**Suggestion:** Extract logical blocks into separate functions.

### Potential Circular Dependency
**Category:** Dependencies
**Description:** Circular import: models/User.ts ‚Üí utils/validation.ts ‚Üí models/User.ts
**Suggestion:** Break cycle with interface/abstraction.","statistics":{"totalFiles":245,"totalLines":52340,"largeFiles":12,"veryLargeFiles":3,"complexFunctions":18,"languages":{"typescript":180,"javascript":65}}}
